Data Processing Agreement

Last updated: 6/20/2025

DATA PROCESSING AGREEMENT

Last Updated: 2025-01-01 This Data Processing Agreement (“ DPA ”) describes how NurivaTech (referred to as “ we ,” “ us ,” or “ our ”) processes personal data collected from or about you (the “ User ”) in connection with our application (“ App ”). By creating an account, installing, or using our App, you acknowledge that you have read and agree to this DPA. If you do not agree, do not use our App.

1. Background & Relationship to Other Agreements

1.1 Purpose

This DPA governs our processing of personal data within the App. It supplements our [ Terms & Conditions ] (the “ Terms ”) and [ Privacy Policy ], which collectively govern your use of the App. In the event of any conflict between the Terms/Privacy Policy and this DPA regarding processing personal data, this DPA takes precedence.

1.2 Roles

  • User (Data Controller) : In certain contexts, you determine what data to submit and how it is used; hence, you act as the “data controller” for data you upload or submit about yourself or (if authorized) others.
  • NurivaTech (Data Processor) : We act as the “data processor” to the extent we process personal data on your behalf, following your instructions as described in this DPA. In some instances, we may also be a “data controller” for compliance purposes (e.g., for our own business needs, analytics, and compliance obligations).

2. Definitions

  • “Personal Data” : Any information relating to an identified or identifiable individual, such as name, email, activity metrics, health details, or other data you provide or is generated via the App.
  • “Processing” : Any operation or set of operations performed on Personal Data, whether by automated means or not (e.g., collecting, storing, using, disclosing, deleting).
  • “Applicable Data Protection Laws” : All privacy and data protection laws that may apply to your use of the App, including the General Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (“GDPR”), the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”), and any relevant U.S. state, federal, or international data privacy regulations.

3. Types of Personal Data Processed

Depending on your use of the App, we may process the following categories of Personal Data:

  1. Contact Information : Name, email address, phone number, login credentials.
  2. Activity & Performance Data : Athletic performance metrics, geolocation (if enabled), training history, or workout data.
  3. Health Status : Health conditions, injuries, rehabilitation info, or other health-related data you choose to input (to the extent permitted by law).
  4. Social Media & Media Files : Profile details, user-generated content, photos, or videos you upload.
  5. AI-Generated Insights : Summaries, analytics, or advice produced by the App’s AI features based on your usage and data input.
  6. Data About Minors : If you provide personal data of minors (under 18 or other age as defined by local law), you must confirm that you are their lawful guardian or have obtained appropriate legal consent.

4. Purpose & Legal Basis of Processing

We only process Personal Data for the following purposes:

  1. Service Delivery : To enable core App functionalities (e.g., tracking workouts, generating coaching insights, storing performance history).
  2. App Administration : To maintain and improve the App, troubleshoot issues, and provide customer support.
  3. AI and Analytics : To offer personalized coaching or social media advice through AI agents, aggregate usage analytics, and performance insights.
  4. Legal & Compliance : To comply with applicable laws, regulations, and valid legal requests (e.g., court orders). Our legal basis for processing may include consent (where required), performance of contract (Terms), or legitimate interests (e.g., App improvement, fraud prevention), as outlined in our Privacy Policy.

5. Processing Instructions

We process your data only:

  1. As Instructed by You : Through your inputs, settings, and configurations within the App.
  2. In Accordance with This DPA : Following the terms set out here and in our Privacy Policy.
  3. In Compliance with Applicable Laws : We observe relevant data protection regulations in handling your Personal Data.

6. Security Measures

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect Personal Data, including:

  1. Encryption : Data may be encrypted in transit (e.g., SSL/TLS) and/or at rest (where feasible).
  2. Access Controls : Role-based permissions and authentication to restrict access to only authorized personnel.
  3. Monitoring & Incident Response : Systems for detecting potential data breaches and processes for responding promptly.
  4. Data Minimization : Collection and storage of only what is necessary to achieve the stated purposes.

While we strive to protect your Personal Data, no system is 100% secure. We encourage you to maintain strong passwords and safeguard your login credentials.

7. Data Sharing & Subprocessors

7.1 Third-Party Service Providers

We may use trusted third parties (“Subprocessors”) to help us operate the App, such as hosting providers, analytics tools, or payment processors. We ensure Subprocessors are subject to contractual obligations that meet or exceed the protections outlined in this DPA.

7.2 Compliance with Laws

We may disclose your Personal Data if required to do so by law or in response to a valid legal request (e.g., subpoena, court order).

7.3 Business Transfers

In the event of a merger, acquisition, or asset sale, your Personal Data may be transferred to a third party involved in the transaction, subject to the same or substantially similar data protection obligations.

8. International Data Transfers

If you reside outside the United States (or outside the European Economic Area), please be aware that we may transfer your Personal Data to our servers or Subprocessors in jurisdictions that may not provide the same level of data protection as your home country. We use legally recognized mechanisms (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses) where required to safeguard such transfers.

9. Data Retention

We retain Personal Data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this DPA or as required by law. After this period, we will securely delete or anonymize your Personal Data. If you delete your account, we will either delete or anonymize your data in accordance with our data retention policies, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law.

10. Data Subject Rights

Depending on your location and Applicable Data Protection Laws, you may have certain rights regarding your Personal Data, such as:

  1. Access : To request a copy of your Personal Data we hold.
  2. Rectification : To correct or update incomplete or inaccurate data.
  3. Erasure : To request deletion of certain data, subject to legal exceptions.
  4. Restriction : To restrict or object to certain types of processing.
  5. Portability : To receive your Personal Data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format. To exercise these rights, please contact us at support@nurivatech.com. We will respond in accordance with Applicable Data Protection Laws.

11. Children’s Privacy

We do not knowingly collect or solicit Personal Data from children without appropriate consent as required by law. If you believe that a child has provided us with Personal Data without the requisite authorization, please contact us immediately at support@nurivatech.com. We will delete such data as soon as practicable unless we are legally obligated to retain it.

12. Data Breach Notification

In the event of a data breach involving Personal Data, we will notify affected users and any applicable supervisory authorities without undue delay and within the timeframes required by law. Our notification will include, where possible:

  • A description of the nature of the breach, including categories and approximate number of data subjects and records involved.
  • The likely consequences of the breach.
  • The measures we have taken or propose to address and mitigate the breach.

13. Updates to this DPA

We may update or modify this DPA from time to time to reflect changes in our practices, technology, or legal obligations. When we make material changes, we will notify you (e.g., by email or prominent notice within the App). Your continued use of the App after such updates signifies your acceptance of the revised DPA.

14. Governing Law

This DPA shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws specified in our [ Terms & Conditions ], unless otherwise required by Applicable Data Protection Laws.

15. Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this DPA, or wish to exercise your data rights, please contact us at:

  • NurivaTech
  • Email : support@nurivatech.com
  • Address : 123 Innovation Drive, Tech City, CA 12345

16. Acceptance of this DPA

By creating an account, installing, or using our App, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by this DPA, as well as our [ Biometrics Privacy Policy ]. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not install, access, or use the App. Click the “I Accept” button or checkbox to confirm your agreement with this Data Processing Agreement.
